qas.question: What would cause the private banking system to weaken?

answers.text: if the debt rescheduling causes losses on loans held by European banks

qas.question: Who purchases the debt of countries that cannot repay and are in danger of default?
What happens when the private banking system is weakened?

answers.text: pressure on the central bank to come to the aid of those banks

qas.question: What is to be used to guarantee the debtors repayment, by the banks assuming their debt?

answers.text: tax revenues and credit of the wealthy member countries

qas.question: Is using the tax revenues and credit of the more stable banks to bail out the ones in danger of default an accepted practice?

plausible_answers.text: if the debt rescheduling causes losses on loans held by European banks

qas.question: What would cause the private banking system to strengthen?
Who steals the debt of countries that cannot repay and are in danger of default?

plausible_answers.text: pressure on the central bank to come to the aid of those banks

qas.question: What happens when the private banking system is gone?

plausible_answers.text: tax revenues and credit of the wealthy member countries

qas.question: What is never to be used to guarantee the debtors repayment, by the banks assuming their debt?
Why is using the tax revenues and credit of the more stable banks to bail out the ones in danger of default an accepted practice?

context: However, <a0_0><b5_0>if the debt rescheduling causes losses on loans held by European banks<b5_0/><a0_0/>, it weakens the private banking system, which then puts <a2_0><b7_0>pressure on the central bank to come to the aid of those banks<b7_0/><a2_0/>. Private-sector bond holders are an integral part of the public and private banking system. Another possible response is for <a1_0><b6_0>wealthy member countries<b6_0/><a1_0/> to guarantee or purchase the debt of countries that have defaulted or are likely to default. This alternative requires that the <a3_0><b8_0>tax revenues and credit of the wealthy member countries<b8_0/><a3_0/> be used to refinance the previous borrowing of the weaker member countries, and <a4_0>is <b9_0>politically controversial<b9_0/><a4_0/>.
